answers.author: Michael Smith
answers.text:
The City of Oklahoma City has been discussing this area and is in the final stages of modifying our city regulations to include ridesharing.  You can view the public discussion and see the related documentation on our website at http://www.okc.gov/AgendaPub/meet.aspx .  Select the Agenda hyperlink for the Sep 15 Traffic Commission and then select item 4F.  The City Council also discussed it at their Sep 9 meeting in item VIII.G.  Future discussion will also be held in upcoming City Council meetings.

author: Toy Beeninga
text:
Uber/Lyft and other ride-sourcing companies are increasing transit options in urban cores.  However, such services often do not fall under traditional/current regulations.   Does anyone have suggestions, best-practices, recent experience, or academic material promoting/discouraging ride-sourcing (often called ridesharing) options? Are regulations needed?   If you would like to provide feedback, please feel free to contact me at TBeeninga@fortlauderdale.gov or call (954) 828-3799. 
Thanks!
title: We have an o͞obər problem.  How to regulate ridesourcing?
